figure.label: The gigs from Granada to Malaga
figure.note: Pen and ink drawing: horses and carriages

div.ab: In verse in the hall of Comares

From the rising to the setting of the sun all Arabia the happy salutes thee, & all the universe. This is the high conclave & we are its daughters. truly I have preference & the Glory in my race or species & I am the members of the heart without any division among them, for in the heart the force of the body & soul (spirit) originates.This seems to be WG's attempt at the Spanish given in the Real Academia de Bellas Artes de San Fernando’s Antigüedades árabes de España. Parte segunda (Madrid, 1804), [hereafter, Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2,] p. 12: 'Desde que amenece hasta que anochece te saluda toda la Arabia feliz y todo el universo. Este es el alto cónclave, y nosotras sus hijas; bien que yo tengo la preferencia y la gloria en mi género, y soy los miembros del corazon, sin que haya entre ellos division ninguna, como que en el corazon tiene su orígen la fuerza del alma y del espíritu.'

another. “Y aunque sean mi adorno los signos de su cielo, con todo se echa en mi de menos el resplandor del sol que hace entre ellos. Cubrióme mi glorioso senor Juseph con vestida de alegria y primor sin necesitar de otro vestido; y me hizo trono regio, cuya altura iguala con verdad a la luz al talamo y al trono celestial.”From Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 12.And although the signs of his sky are my ornament, yet I miss the radiance of the sun that shines [AA: 'luce', not 'hace'] between them. My glorious Lord Jusef covered me in clothes of joy and beauty without needing other clothing; and made me a royal throne, whose height truly equals the light, the marriage bed and the celestial throne. the iron balconies placed in 1632. Inscription mentioning the beauty of this hall of the EmbaxadoresAmbassadors. Antiqüedades arabes. 1604. O hijo de Rey e descendiente de Reyes y à quien las estrellas en alteza no igualan, si a te se comparan! Si edificaste e ilustraste este tan rico alcazar, que es singular y de aventajada hermosura; palacio donde se demuestran las singulares excelencias de esta gobernacion, que en las escrituras se aclaran. Con el la ley de la salvacion ensalzaste en tanto grado que no se puede significcar, ilustrandola y a sus sequaces con extrema ventaja de seguridad y honor; por lo qual te son a cargo; pues con todos sus vasallos demostras amparo miserecordia justicia liberalidad soalzacion clemencia e ninguna crueldad e injusticia” From Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 13Oh son of a King and descendant of Kings, and whom the stars do not equal in highness, if they are compared to you! If you built and illustrated [or improved?] so rich a fortress as this, which is singular and of outstanding beauty; a palace where the singular excellencies of this government are shown, which become clear in the scriptures. With it you extolled the law of salvation to such a degree that [to say] illustrating [or improving?] it and its minions with the extreme benefit of safety and honour, cannot capture it, for which reason they are in your charge, since with all your [AA has 'tus'] vassals you show [AA: 'demostrais'] protection, mercy [AA: 'misericordia'], justice, liberality, solace, clemency, and no cruelty or [AA: 'ni'] injustice.Translation of 'soalzacion' as 'solace' based on Juan de Echeverría, Paseos por Granada y sus contornos..., 2 vols (2nd edn, Granada, 1814), vol. 1, p. 121, which suggests 'consuelo', 'alegria' or 'alabanza' as synonyms for what Echeverría recognises as a rare word–

On another. “Es el Rey Nasere el mayor de los Reyes; de cuya corte salen las grandezas de los triunfos, es el adestrador leader con poderio y valor, que a todos las naciones pone espanto. Es el que, si en el hemisferio se presentase, serian excusados en el los luceros. Es el que a los Reyes admira la limpieza de su nacimiento, e a quien los grandes imitan, viendo xFrom Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 13.The Nasrid King is the greatest of Kings; from whose court come the grandeurs of triumphs; he is the skilled one with might and courage, who terrifies all nations. It is he who, if he appeared in the hemisphere, the stars would be dismissed by him. It is he who provokes admiration among Kings for the purity of his birth, and he whom the great imitate, seeing... [how admirably he has dispensed his rigour and his clemency with those to whom he owes it]WG has corrected to 'adestrador', which he translates as 'leader', but Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 13 does have 'el adestrado' (skilled one).

note.rs: Patio de los ArrayonesCourt of the Myrtles

div.note: Inscriptions of the first court God alone is the conqueror. other inscrip in same court. The omnipotence of God Give glory to our lord & King Abulhagiagi whom god preserve. In the upper gallery an arch of 3 varasUnit of measurement, explained on pag 190. ½ lead to a chamber over the vestibule before the palace of Carlos 5 was built
The walls of cistern court 24 feet high Castilian. The cistern 124 feet high 27 wide 5 deep. the doors of this court are 4 feet ½ broad 8 high. above the 2 windows God alone is the conqueror.

Aben Hut Almayars arms says Bermudes de Pedraza. Argt on a band Sa There is no conqueror but God. sometimes a red hand.Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 6: 'Aben Hut Alnayar'. Antigüedades Arabes here cites Francisco Bermudez de Pedraza, Historia de la antigüedad y excelencias de Granada (Madrid: Luis Sanchez, 1608). Aben Hut Alnayar's arms were a black band on a silver field, with letters saying 'There is no conqueror but God'. The antechamber roofed [drawing: arch]
the kind of work called Comarragia, Niches alternate gold blue white & red.

on targets Dese alabanza a solo Dios y. de consiguiente dense gracias al mismo DiosFrom Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 10.Give praise to God alone, and therefore give thanks to the same God [or God himself].. The hall 40 feet square by 68. iii. The tiles 1 vara ½ high above this in ovals “o god to thee be given honour for ever. & o lord to thee incessant thanks. Give honor & glory to the King our Lord Abu Abdallah Elgani Billah
